meaning: 1)  She is seated on a greatest throne (maha + asana). She is Śrīmat Simhāsaneśvarī (refer nama 3).2)  ‘Mahat’ the fundamental principle (tattva) behind this creation is Her seat (asana).
commentary: This fundamental principle (tattva) Mahat is the root for all this creation including the creation of the five basic elements (pancha maha bhoothas). By retaining this Mahat as Her seat She teaches us that She is over and above this creation.
